revised_title: Predicting Software Reliability: Techniques and Challenges
tldr: This article surveys the state of the art of software reliability modeling and focuses on assessing and predicting the reliability growth that occurs as faults are found and fixed. The author presents a conceptual model of the software failure process and discusses various techniques for measuring and predicting software reliability. The article also highlights the challenges and future research directions in software reliability, particularly in safety-critical systems.
